faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens have the same rights as Spanish nationals. Non-EU buyers may require an NIE number and must declare their ownership, but purchase restrictions are minimal. Our team can provide guidance on the necessary documentation and legal requirements.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs including transfer tax (6-10%), notary and registration fees (approximately 1-2% of property value), and potential legal fees (0.5-1%). Your total acquisition cost typically ranges from 8-13% above the advertised price. We recommend consulting a Spanish property lawyer for detailed breakdown specific to your purchase.
